intro: Nabaluia exaltata, commonly known as the tall napali, is a flowering plant native to the island of Hawaii. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its upright growth habit and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to the humid, tropical climate of its native habitat. Nabaluia exaltata plays an important ecological role in supporting local pollinators and maintaining the biodiversity of Hawaiian ecosystems.
